page.title: 06PORTHMADOG LANGUAGE
page.content: This is a bilingual area.About 70% of the people have Welsh as their mother-tongue.They can all,except some pre-school children,speak English. During the past decade,largely through the influence of Plaid Cymru and the Welsh Language Society,fervent efforts have been made to safeguard the Welsh language.No schoolteacher is appointed unless Welsh-speaking.In council appointments priority is given to Welsh speakers.The non-conformist chapel services are entirely in Welsh. There are bilingual services at the Roman Catholic Church and the Church in Wales.The W.I.meetings are conducted in English.Merched y Wawr is an all-Welsh organisation for women. There is a strong branch of Urdd Gobaith Cymru.The council and Post Office issue bilingual forms.Road- signs are bilingual.
